<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Non-cash
amounts have been excluded. </FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-
bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1>(2)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-

of oil and gas transportation costs, but before the effects of commodity 
derivative instruments. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs
p;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=1013195,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]CA76901A.;16',USER='MPAPADI',CD=';7-AUG-2013;22:48' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_cc76901_1_3"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"PMS662" -->
</FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=6><B>President's Message  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>During the second 
quarter of 2013, our operations in both Canada and the U.S.&nbsp;continued to 
perform ahead of our expectations. Daily production was up 10%
over the second quarter of 2012 and 3% higher than the first quarter of 2013, 
averaging 90,037&nbsp;BOE/day. The most significant increases were in our 
natural gas assets in both Canada and the
U.S.&nbsp;as a result of successful drilling activity in the Wilrich and 
continued strong performance in the Marcellus. For the first six months of 2013,
daily production has averaged
88,618&nbsp;BOE/day, significantly ahead of our expectations. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
continued to improve the profitability of our operations through disciplined 
cost management and capital spending. Drilling and development activities in 
Canada slowed during the
quarter, resulting in a 20% decrease in capital spending compared to the first 
quarter of 2013. Approximately $140&nbsp;million was invested across our 
portfolio with over 80% of our spending
dedicated to our oil properties in both Canada and the U.S.&nbsp;In the first 
half of 2013, we've invested approximately $313&nbsp;million in development 
capital which is about 45% of our full
year budget. Our North Dakota operations continued to attract the majority of 
our capital investment given the strong economic returns from this region. 
Operating costs and general and administrative
costs also continue to track with&nbsp;guidance. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
a result of higher production, improved capital efficiencies and an improvement 
in our netback, the sustainability of our business has continued to improve. 
Funds flow increased by
almost 20% during the quarter to approximately $205&nbsp;million, more than 
covering our capital spending and dividends. Our adjusted payout ratio decreased
to 89% in the quarter, and on a
year-to-date basis, is approximately 106% before considering the proceeds of our
divestment activities. As a result of non-core asset sales and the increase in 
funds flow, our trailing 12&nbsp;month
debt-to-funds flow ratio also improved, falling to 1.6&nbsp;times at the end of 
the&nbsp;quarter. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
hedging program continues to be an important element in reducing the risk to our
funds flow and has generated approximately $21&nbsp;million year-to-date in cash
gains. As the
majority of our funds flow comes from crude oil revenues, we continue to enter 
into additional WTI hedge positions in order to provide greater certainty of our
future funds flow. We now have 75% of
our remaining 2013 crude oil production, after royalties, hedged at a price of 
US$100.35 per barrel and we have 56% of our expected 2014 crude oil production 
volumes, net of royalties, hedged at an
average price of US$93.06 per barrel. We also have 32% of our remaining 2013 
natural gas volumes, after royalties, hedged at an average price of $3.51 per 
Mcf. For 2014, we have 24% of our expected
net natural gas production hedged against the NYMEX benchmark at a price of 
US$4.17 per Mcf with an additional 2% hedged against the AECO benchmark at a 
price of $3.85 per&nbsp;Mcf. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
have also continued to consolidate our portfolio. We increased the concentration
in our Canadian waterflood portfolio through the acquisition of an additional 
50% working interest in
the Pouce Coupe Boundary Lake light oil pool in Alberta for approximately 
$34&nbsp;million, after adjustments. As previously announced, we have also 
either sold or entered into agreements to sell
approximately 1,300&nbsp;BOE/day of non-core producing assets, net of 
acquisitions. In addition, we have also closed the sale of infrastructure assets
in
the Fort Berthold region for approximately $34&nbsp;million. Year-to-date, 
including agreements signed, we have sold approximately $192&nbsp;million in 
non-core assets and invested approximately
$55&nbsp;million in acquisitions in our core areas. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
a result of lower drilling activity during the second quarter and planned turn-
around activity, along with the impact of non-core property divestments, we 
expect to see a decline in
production volumes during the third quarter. Although production has exceeded 
expectations year-to-date, we are not increasing our annual average production 
guidance beyond 85,000&nbsp;BOE/day given
our plans to continue to rationalize additional assets over the course of the 
year. If we are unable to complete additional divestments, we would expect our 
annual average and exit production to
potentially exceed our current guidance. As the majority of the sales completed 
to date have been crude oil properties and with the growth in our natural gas 
production from our core assets, we now
expect our crude oil and liquids production will represent approximately 48% of 
our total volumes in&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

SIZE=2><B>&#150;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=14 style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE SIZE=4 
COLOR="#0B2777"></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>*</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Wells
drilled during the quarter that are pending potential completion/tie-in or 
abandonment as at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013. </FONT></DD><DT style='font-
family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>**</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Total
wells brought on-stream during the quarter regardless of when they 
were&nbsp;drilled. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>U.S.&nbsp;Crude 
Oil  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Production from our 
U.S.&nbsp;crude oil assets increased slightly during the second quarter 
primarily due to drilling activity at Fort Berthold, North Dakota. We invested
approximately $78&nbsp;million drilling 4.7&nbsp;net long horizontal wells and 
bringing 6.1&nbsp;net horizontal wells on-stream with the majority of the wells 
brought on late in the quarter.
Service and supply costs continue to be lower than our original expectations 
with a 10% savings realized on well costs year-to-date. Production from Fort 
Berthold continues to be on track with our
expectations and averaged just over 15,000&nbsp;BOE/day during the&nbsp;quarter.
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Canadian Crude Oil
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Production from our 
Canadian crude oil properties was down slightly from the first quarter, 
averaging approximately 21,300&nbsp;BOE/day due to a slow down in development
activity and the sale of non-core production. The majority of our activities 
were focused on drilling additional producing wells in our waterflood properties
at Medicine Hat and Giltedge. We also
acquired an incremental 50% working interest in the Pouce Coupe South Boundary 
Lake&nbsp;waterflood property during the quarter, taking our working interest to
approximately 100%. This property has
a very low historical decline rate of roughly 5% with an average netback of 
approximately $50/BOE and we believe there is future upside potential through 
incremental drilling and waterflood
optimization. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs
p;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=4,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=351310,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]CC76901A.;6',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:09' -->
<A NAME="page_cc76901_1_5"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>U.S.&nbsp;Natural 
Gas  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>U.S.&nbsp;natural gas
production grew by more than 10% during the quarter, averaging approximately 
104&nbsp;MMcf/day. The majority of our U.S.&nbsp;gas production is from
the Marcellus region in northeast Pennsylvania which produced on average 
88&nbsp;MMcf/day of natural gas during the quarter, up 11% from the first 
quarter. We continue to see strong well
performance, particularly in the Bradford and Susquehanna areas where 
approximately 90% of our Marcellus capital is being allocated. As a result of 
the growth in production volumes and increasing
natural gas prices, we have seen a significant increase in funds flow from our 
Marcellus operations in 2013 generating approximately $34&nbsp;million in funds 
flow year-to-date which has fully
funded our capital spending to date in this&nbsp;region. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Canadian Natural 
Gas  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Based upon the 
success of our drilling activity to date in the Wilrich, we plan to drill two 
additional horizontal development wells in the Ansell area in the latter half of
the year with an expected on-stream early in 2014. We also plan to begin 
drilling two Montney horizontal wells at our Cameron/Julienne property in 
northeast British Columbia in the fourth quarter. The
first of two vertical wells testing the Duvernay is currently underway. We 
expect to finish drilling both of these wells in the fourth quarter 
of&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>U.S.&nbsp;Filing 
Status  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>As a result of the 
increase in value of our U.S.&nbsp;assets combined with the majority of our 
shareholders residing in the U.S., effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2014, we
anticipate that Enerplus will no longer qualify as a "foreign private issuer" 
under U.S.&nbsp;securities regulations. Enerplus would then be considered a 
U.S.&nbsp;domestic issuer and would become
subject to U.S.&nbsp;domestic reporting requirements from that date forward. The
change in filing status would not impact our operations, but would change the 
way in which we report and file our
operating and financial results. For example, our financial statements would be 
prepared under U.S.&nbsp;Generally Accepted Accounting Principles. We do not 
expect a material change in most of our
key performance indicators such as funds flow, debt levels, capital spending, 
operating costs, G&amp;A expenses, netbacks or adjusted payout ratio. Sales 
revenues and production volumes would
be reported on a net (after royalty) basis however we will also provide 
supplementary disclosures for gross sales revenue and volumes to facilitate 
comparison with Canadian peers. In addition to
filing our reserves under Canadian National Instrument&nbsp;51-101 standards, 
our reserves information would also be prepared and filed under the U.S. 
SEC&nbsp;standards. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Summary  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Enerplus has
undergone significant change in our portfolio and strategy over the past few 
years. The impact of these changes is being reflected in our improved 
operational
performance. Based upon our results for the first half of 2013 and including the
non-core asset sales we've made year-to-date, we expect to meet or beat our 
guidance this year. We've achieved
significant growth in production and funds flow and our balance sheet remains 
strong. As a result of this performance, we are delivering profitable growth and
income to our&nbsp;investors. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Ian
C. Dundas<BR>
President&nbsp;&amp; Chief Executive Officer </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_de76901_1_6"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"PMS662" -->
</FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=6><B>Management's Discussion and Analysis  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=4>Management's 
Discussion and Analysis ("MD&amp;A") </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The following 
discussion and analysis of financial results is dated August&nbsp;8,&nbsp;2013 
and is to be read in conjunction&nbsp;with: </FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>the
unaudited interim consolidated financial statements of Enerplus Corporation 
("Enerplus" or the "Company") as at and for the three and six months ended
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 and 2012 (the&nbsp;"Interim Financial Statements"),
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>the
audited consolidated financial statements of Enerplus as at and for the years 
ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012 and 2011 (the&nbsp;"Financial
Statements");&nbsp;and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>the
MD&amp;A of Enerplus for the year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012 
(the&nbsp;"Annual MD&amp;A"). </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>All
amounts are stated in Canadian dollars unless otherwise specified and all note 
references relate to the notes included with the Interim Financial Statements. 
Where applicable, natural gas has been
converted to barrels of oil equivalent ("BOE") based on 6&nbsp;Mcf:1&nbsp;BOE 
and oil and natural gas liquids ("NGL") have been converted to thousand 
cubic&nbsp;feet of gas
equivalent ("Mcfe") based on 0.167&nbsp;bbl:1&nbsp;Mcfe. The BOE and Mcfe rates 
are based on an energy equivalent conversion method primarily applicable at the
burner tip and do not represent a value equivalent at the wellhead. Given that 
the value ratio based on the current price of natural gas as compared to crude 
oil is significantly different from the
energy equivalency of 6:1, utilizing a conversion on a 6:1&nbsp;basis may be 
misleading as an indication of value. Use of BOE and Mcfe in isolation may be 
misleading. All production volumes are
presented on a company interest basis, being the Company's working interest 
share before deduction of any royalties paid to others plus the Company's 
royalty interests. Company interest is not a term
defined in Canadian National Instrument&nbsp;51-101- Standards of Disclosure for
Oil and Gas Activities ("NI&nbsp;51-101") and may not be comparable to 
information produced by
other&nbsp;entities. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following MD&amp;A contains forward-looking information and statements. We refer
you to the discussion at the end of the MD&amp;A under "Forward-Looking 
Information and Statements" for
further information. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>NON-GAAP MEASURES 
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The Company utilizes 
the following terms for measurement within the MD&amp;A that do not have a 
standardized meaning or definition as prescribed by International Financial
Reporting Standards ("IFRS") and therefore may not be comparable with the 
calculation of similar measures by other&nbsp;entities: </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>"Adjusted payout 
ratio"</B></FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2> is used to analyze operating 
performance, leverage and liquidity. We calculate our adjusted payout ratio as 
dividends to
shareholders, net of our stock dividends and the Company's former Dividend 
Reinvestment Plan ("DRIP") proceeds, plus capital spending (including office 
capital) divided by funds&nbsp;flow. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2><B>"Netback"</B></FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2> is used to evaluate 
operating performance of our crude oil and natural gas assets. The term netback 
is calculated as oil and gas sales revenue
(net&nbsp;of transportation), less royalties and operating costs. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>OVERVIEW  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Our strong
operational performance continued during the second quarter. Production levels 
increased to 90,037&nbsp;BOE/day, which is an increase of 10% year over year and
3%
from the first quarter of 2013. Our capital program is on track with spending of
$139.7&nbsp;million during the quarter, with approximately 80% of this spending 
being directed towards our crude oil
properties. Operating expenses of $10.42/BOE and general and administrative 
expenses ("G&amp;A") of $2.29/BOE were in-line with our expectations. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Funds
flow for the second quarter totaled $204.7&nbsp;million, an increase of 
$58.2&nbsp;million or 40% from the second quarter of 2012 and an increase of 
$32.1&nbsp;million or 19%
from the first quarter of 2013. Funds flow continued to strengthen with higher 
production volumes and improved realized crude oil and natural gas prices. Net 
income for the quarter totaled
$52.6&nbsp;million, down from $100.3&nbsp;million in the second quarter of 2012 
due to lower non-cash mark-to-market gains on commodity derivative instruments. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
continued to sell non-core properties in order to focus our asset portfolio. 
During the quarter we raised proceeds of $71.3&nbsp;million through non-core 
asset sales. Subsequent to
the quarter, we have signed agreements for additional non-core asset 
dispositions for proceeds of approximately $119.7&nbsp;million, bringing our 
year-to-date expected proceeds to approximately
$192.3&nbsp;million. These divestments have also helped to maintain our balance 
sheet strength and sustainability. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs
p;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=6,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=829315,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DE76901A.;39',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:11' -->
<A NAME="page_de76901_1_7"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
adjusted payout ratio continued to improve, decreasing to 89% in the second 
quarter of 2013. This improvement is due to an increase in our funds flow as 
well as lower capital
spending. At June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, we had a conservative trailing twelve 
month debt to funds flow ratio of 1.6x and approximately $670.0&nbsp;million of 
available capacity on our bank credit
facility. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
on our strong year-to-date operational performance we are continuing to maintain
all of our operational guidance measures. Although production has exceeded 
expectations
year-to-date, we are not increasing our annual average production guidance 
beyond 85,000&nbsp;BOE/day given our plans for additional divestments over the 
remainder of the year. We also expect that
our annual cash based equity compensation expenses will increase from $0.45/BOE 
to $0.60/BOE given our current share performance. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Production  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Production increased 
to 90,037&nbsp;BOE/day in the second quarter of 2013 from 87,183&nbsp;BOE/day in
the first quarter of 2013. In comparison to the second quarter of
2012, production increased by 10% or 7,929&nbsp;BOE/day. Crude oil volumes were 
up by 4% due to increased production from our Fort Berthold property and natural
gas volumes increased by 15% due to
increased production from our Marcellus and Wilrich&nbsp;assets. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With
the continued strength in our natural gas production and our oil weighted non-
core divestments, our weighting of crude oil and liquids production decreased to
46% of our total
production in the second quarter of 2013. We are now expecting our crude oil and
liquids weighting to average 48% for&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Average
daily production volumes for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 and 2012 are outlined&nbsp;below: </FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>We expect production 
levels will decline in the third quarter given the reduction in our drilling 
activity in the second quarter, expected plant maintenance,
and the impact of divestments. Although production has exceeded expectations 
year-to-date, we are not increasing our annual average production guidance 
beyond 85,000&nbsp;BOE/day given our plans to
continue to rationalize additional assets over the remainder of the year. If we 
are unable to complete additional divestments, our annual average and exit 
production could potentially exceed our
current guidance. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=7,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=932777,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DE76901A.;39',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:11' -->
<A NAME="page_de76901_1_8"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Pricing  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The prices received 
for our crude oil and natural gas production directly impact our earnings, funds
flow and financial condition. The following table compares quarterly
average prices from the second quarter of 2012 to the second quarter 
of&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Net
of oil and gas transportation costs, but before the effects of commodity 
derivative instruments. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Crude Oil and Natural
Gas Liquids </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Crude oil prices 
remained range-bound during the second quarter of 2013 with WTI prices typically
trading between US$87/bbl and US$97/bbl. Overall, the average price was
relatively unchanged from the first quarter of 2013 at US$94.22/bbl. Globally, 
Brent prices weakened relative to the WTI benchmark, with the 
Brent&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;WTI spread
narrowing from US$18.24/bbl during the first quarter to US$9.14/bbl during the 
second quarter. WTI prices have been supported by the startup of new pipeline 
projects which have eased the
transportation bottleneck between Cushing and the Gulf&nbsp;Coast. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Canadian
crude differentials also improved significantly during the second quarter as 
refineries returned from outages. During the quarter, light differentials were 
much narrower due to
lower than expected synthetic crude output from oilsands producers. Heavy 
differentials also narrowed due to the delay of new production and 
debottlenecking of pipeline capacity. Differentials in
North Dakota versus WTI widened again in the second quarter as the narrowing of 
the price difference between Cushing WTI and the Gulf Coast resulted in lower 
rail netbacks. As Enerplus and other
producers depend on moving a portion of North Dakota production by rail to the 
Gulf Coast, this negatively impacted our overall netback for Fort Berthold. The 
amount of production that we ship by rail
to the Gulf Coast will vary over time due to transportation access constraints 
and changes in the price differential between Cushing and the Gulf Coast. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Natural
gas liquid prices weakened during the quarter due to takeaway and fractionation 
capacity issues in Alberta along with strong North American liquids production. 
As expected, we
realized a significant drop in our natural gas liquids prices due to the re-
contracting of volumes as of April&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2013. We expect prices to remain
weak through 2013 and 2014 until new
fractionation capacity is built within&nbsp;Alberta. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
average price received for our crude oil production (net&nbsp;of transportation 
costs) in the second quarter of 2013 increased by 12% to $82.95/bbl from 
$74.36/bbl for the same
period in 2012. The improvement in our pricing is due to narrower differentials 
as well as a continued portfolio shift towards lighter crude oil with our 
production growth in North&nbsp;Dakota. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs
p;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=8,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=906523,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DE76901A.;39',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:11' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_dg76901_1_9"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"PMS662" -->
</FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Natural Gas </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Natural gas prices 
continued to rally in the second quarter with cooler end-of-winter weather 
causing storage levels to decrease. However, prices peaked in May and have since
fallen as U.S.&nbsp;gas production continues to increase, in particular in the 
Marcellus play, coal prices remain very competitive compared to gas for power 
generation, and summer gas consumption
for cooling demand has&nbsp;moderated. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
Canada, the price at AECO fell relative to Henry Hub during the quarter, as 
export demand dropped and Western Canadian storage began to quickly fill. We see
some potential for the
AECO basis differential to remain wider for the rest of summer 2013, before 
narrowing again later in the&nbsp;year. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
the U.S., we continue to see premium pricing for our liquids rich gas located in
North Dakota and Montana. In the Marcellus we have contracted long term sales 
that are based on
monthly and daily indexes. In June daily spot prices, in particular into 
Tennessee Gas Pipeline, fell rapidly as industry production growth continued to 
surprise, bringing our overall Marcellus price
to US$0.18/Mcf below NYMEX for the quarter. We expect that wider differentials 
will continue until pipeline expansions are built to manage excess gas from 
producing areas. Accessing new and
incremental markets will be necessary to consume the growing gas production in 
the Marcellus region. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
the three months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 we sold our natural gas for an 
average price of $3.70/Mcf (net&nbsp;of transportation costs) which represented 
a 19% increase
from an average price of $3.10/mcf received during the first quarter of 2013. 
Our realized price increases were in-line with the strengthening of the AECO 
Monthly and NYMEX indices during this period.
Our natural gas sales mix continues to include exposure to these indices for 
both our Canadian and U.S.&nbsp;production. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Price Risk 
Management  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>We have a price risk 
management program that is designed to mitigate a portion of the variability in 
commodity prices. The program considers our overall financial position
along with the economics of our capital program and potential acquisitions. At 
current commodity prices our crude oil production accounts for approximately 75%
of our corporate netback and therefore
we believe it is prudent to have a significant level of downside price 
protection. We continued to add fixed price positions during and subsequent to 
the quarter given the rally in crude prices. As of
July&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2013 we have swapped 22,250&nbsp;bbls/day for the remainder 
of 2013 at an average price of US$100.35/bbl, representing approximately 75% of 
our forecasted net oil production
after royalties. For the first half of 2014, we have swapped 
19,000&nbsp;bbls/day, representing approximately 64% of our forecasted net 
production after royalties, at
an average price of US$93.39/bbl. For the second half of 2014 we have swapped 
14,000&nbsp;bbls/day, representing approximately 47% of our forecasted net 
production after royalties, at an average
price of US$92.61/bbl. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
a result of the Brent&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;WTI differential narrowing during and 
subsequent to the quarter, and the potential that it could widen again, we have
also added Brent&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;WTI fixed and ratio spread basis positions. We
have entered into fixed basis spread positions for the remainder of 2013 where 
we pay the WTI
calendar month average price and receive the Brent calendar month average price 
less a fixed spread of $7.09/bbl on 5,000&nbsp;bbls/day. For 2014 we have 
entered into ratio spread basis positions
where we pay the WTI calendar month average price and receive 92.9% of the Brent
calendar month average price on 2,000&nbsp;bbls/day. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
added minimally to our natural gas hedge position during the quarter as hedging 
crude provides more funds flow protection. As of July&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2013 we have
downside
protection representing approximately 32% of our forecasted natural gas 
production after royalties for the remainder of 2013. This protection is 
comprised of 51,100&nbsp;Mcf/day at AECO $3.41/Mcf
before premiums and 15,000&nbsp;Mcf/day swapped at NYMEX US$3.85/Mcf. For 2014 
we have swapped 50,000&nbsp;Mcf/day at NYMEX US$4.17/Mcf and another 
4,700&nbsp;Mcf/day at AECO $3.96/Mcf,
representing approximately 26% of our forecasted net production after royalties.
</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=181083,FOLIO='9',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DG76901A.;6',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:13' -->
<A NAME="page_dg76901_1_10"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following is a summary of our financial contracts in place at 
July&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2013 expressed as a percentage of our anticipated net 
production volumes after royalties: </FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Based
on weighted average price (before premiums), assumed average annual production 
of 85,000&nbsp;BOE/day for 2013 and 2014, less royalties of&nbsp;21%. 
</FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>See Note&nbsp;14 for 
further information on our commodity hedging. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Accounting for Price 
Risk Management </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>During the second 
quarter of 2013 we realized cash gains of $11.0&nbsp;million on our crude oil 
contracts and cash losses of $1.9&nbsp;million on our natural gas contracts.
In comparison, during the second quarter of 2012 we realized cash gains of 
$5.0&nbsp;million on our crude oil contracts. The crude oil gains realized in 
2013 and 2012 were due to contracts that
provided floor protection above market prices. The natural gas losses realized 
in the current quarter were due to market&nbsp;prices rising above our fixed 
price positions. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
the forward markets for crude oil and natural gas fluctuate and new contracts 
are executed and existing contracts are realized, changes in fair value are 
reflected as either a
non-cash charge or gain to earnings. At the end of the second quarter of 2013 
the fair value of our crude oil and natural gas contracts represented gain 
positions of $29.8&nbsp;million and
$7.2&nbsp;million respectively. For the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 the fair value of our crude oil contracts increased 
$8.7&nbsp;million and decreased
$20.9&nbsp;million respectively, while the fair value of our natural gas 
contracts increased $12.8&nbsp;million and $3.8&nbsp;million respectively. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
the second quarter of 2012 we saw significant decreases in forecast crude oil 
prices, which resulted in unrealized gains of $137.7&nbsp;million and 
$120.6&nbsp;million for the
three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012 respectively. </FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Revenues  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Crude oil and natural
gas revenues were $398.6&nbsp;million ($404.8&nbsp;million, net of 
$6.2&nbsp;million of transportation costs) in the second quarter of 2013,
representing an increase of 27% or $84.2&nbsp;million from $314.4&nbsp;million 
($321.2&nbsp;million, net of $6.8&nbsp;million of transportation costs) during 
the same period in 2012. Crude oil
and natural gas revenues for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 were 
$764.8&nbsp;million ($778.2&nbsp;million, net of $13.4&nbsp;million of 
transportation costs), an increase of
$111.5&nbsp;million or 17% from $653.3&nbsp;million ($666.3&nbsp;million, net of
$13.0&nbsp;million in transportation costs) for the same period in 2012. Crude 
oil and natural gas revenues
increased due to improvements in realized prices as well as higher production 
levels during the&nbsp;period. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Net
of oil and gas transportation costs, but before the effects of commodity 
derivative instruments. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Royalties  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Royalties are paid to
various government entities and other land and mineral rights owners. For the 
three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 royalties were
$81.4&nbsp;million and $156.0&nbsp;million respectively, compared to 
$62.5&nbsp;million and $129.2&nbsp;million for the same periods of 2012. As a 
percentage of oil and gas sales, net of
transportation costs, royalties were 20% for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, unchanged from 2012. We continue to expect an average 
royalty rate of approximately 21%
in&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Operating Expenses
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Our operating 
expenses were on track at $85.4&nbsp;million or $10.42/BOE during the second 
quarter of 2013 and $166.7&nbsp;million or $10.39/BOE for the six months ended
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013. In comparison, we had operating costs of 
$80.5&nbsp;million or $10.78/BOE and $152.6&nbsp;million or $10.40/BOE for the 
same periods in 2012. Our operating costs have
improved on a per BOE basis in 2013 mainly due to increased production from our 
Marcellus and Fort Berthold properties which have lower operating costs. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
are maintaining our annual guidance of $10.70/BOE for operating costs 
during&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=497557,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK108:

<A NAME="page_dg76901_1_12"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Netbacks  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The following tables 
outline our crude oil and natural gas netbacks for the three and six months 
ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 and 2012. The crude oil and natural gas
classifications below contain properties according to their dominant production 
category. These properties may include associated crude oil, natural gas or 
natural gas liquids volumes which have been
converted to the equivalent BOE/day or Mcfe/day and as such, the revenue per BOE
or per Mcfe may not correspond with the average selling price under the 
"Pricing" section of this&nbsp;MD&amp;A. </FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>See
"Non-GAAP Measures" in this MD&amp;A. </FONT></DD><DT style='font-
family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(2)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Net
of oil and gas transportation costs. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Our crude oil 
properties accounted for 77% of our corporate netback before hedging for the 
first six months of 2013 compared to 86% for the same period in 2012.
Crude oil netbacks after hedging per BOE have increased for the three and six 
months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 primarily due to higher realized crude oil 
prices and cash hedging gains. Natural
gas netbacks per Mcfe after hedging increased mainly due to higher realized 
natural gas&nbsp;prices. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>General and
Administrative Expenses ("G&amp;A")  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>G&amp;A expenses 
decreased during the second quarter of 2013 to $18.8&nbsp;million or $2.29/BOE 
compared to $20.7&nbsp;million or $2.76/BOE in the second quarter of 2012,
mainly due to lower legal and professional fees. For the six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 G&amp;A expenses increased to $43.5&nbsp;million or 
$2.71/BOE compared to $41.4&nbsp;million or
$2.82/BOE for the same period in 2012, primarily due to one-time charges 
recorded in the first quarter of&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="40%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777"
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=7 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1><B>Three months ended June&nbsp;30,</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE
COLOR="#0B2777"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=7 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1><B>Six months ended June&nbsp;30,</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE 
COLOR="#0B2777"></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>We continue to expect
cash G&amp;A expenses to be approximately $2.70/BOE during&nbsp;2013. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Equity Based 
Compensation Expenses  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Equity based 
compensation expenses totaled $5.9&nbsp;million for the second quarter of 2013 
and $12.4&nbsp;million for the first six months of 2013, compared to
$0.3&nbsp;million and $4.9&nbsp;million during the same periods during 2012. 
These expenses include charges related to our long-term incentive plans 
("LTI&nbsp;plans") and our stock option plan
(see&nbsp;Note&nbsp;13 for further details). The costs of our LTI plans are 
dependent on our share price and can fluctuate from period to period. The 
increased costs in 2013 were the result of the
increase in our share&nbsp;price. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
also recorded non-cash gains on our LTI equity swaps of $0.8&nbsp;million for 
the second quarter and $2.3&nbsp;million for the first six months of 2013,
compared to
$0.3&nbsp;million of non-cash gains during the same periods in 2012. Utilizing 
the swaps, we have </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=13,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=1009735,FOLIO='13',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DG76901A.;6',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:13' -->
<A NAME="page_dg76901_1_14"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>effectively
fixed the future settlement cost on our LTI plans at a weighted average price of
$13.21 per share on 1,130,000&nbsp;shares, representing approximately 70% of the
notional shares
outstanding under these&nbsp;plans. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Based on our current 
share price performance, we have increased our forecast for cash equity based 
compensation for 2013 from $0.45/BOE to&nbsp;$0.60/BOE. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Finance Expense  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Interest on our 
senior notes and bank credit facility for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 totaled $14.3&nbsp;million and $28.5&nbsp;million
respectively, compared to $13.4&nbsp;million and $24.3&nbsp;million for the same
periods in 2012. The increase is due to higher average debt levels in 2013 along
with an increased weighting of
senior notes with higher interest&nbsp;rates. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-cash
amounts recorded in finance expense include accretion of decommissioning 
liabilities, amortization of debt transaction costs and unrealized gains and 
losses resulting from the
change in fair value of our interest rate swaps and the interest component on 
our cross currency interest rate swap ("CCIRS"). See Note&nbsp;10 for further 
details. </FONT></P>

June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 approximately 68% of our debt was based on fixed 
interest&nbsp;rates. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>14&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb
sp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>

<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=14,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=84747,FOLIO='14',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DG76901A.;6',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:13' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_di76901_1_15"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"PMS662" -->
</FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Foreign Exchange  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>We recorded a net 
foreign exchange loss of $2.2&nbsp;million during the second quarter of 2013. In
comparison, realized foreign exchange losses of $11.2&nbsp;million were
offset by unrealized foreign exchange gains of $11.2&nbsp;million during the 
second quarter of&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
the second quarter of 2013 the Canadian dollar continued to weaken against the 
U.S.&nbsp;dollar. On June&nbsp;19,&nbsp;2013 we made the fourth 
US$35.0&nbsp;million
principal repayment on our US$175.0&nbsp;million senior notes. In connection 
with this payment we also settled the underlying CCIRS, which resulted in an 
$18.0&nbsp;million realized foreign
exchange loss. This realized loss was partially offset by realized foreign 
exchange gains on the settlement of short-term U.S.&nbsp;dollar bank debt that 
matured during the&nbsp;period. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
recorded net unrealized foreign exchange gains during the second quarter of 
$12.7&nbsp;million, mainly due to mark-to-market gains on our CCIRS and foreign 
exchange swaps. These
gains were partially offset by unrealized losses on the period end translation 
of our U.S.&nbsp;dollar debt and working capital. See Note&nbsp;11 for further 
details. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Capital Investment
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Capital spending for 
the second quarter totaled $139.7&nbsp;million compared to $208.6&nbsp;million 
during the same period in 2012 and $172.9&nbsp;million during the
first quarter of 2013. Spending levels in the quarter slowed due to the timing 
of development plans, spring break-up and wet weather in June. Despite the slow-
down our annual capital program is on
track and we continue to expect annual spending of approximately 
$685&nbsp;million. Second quarter spending was primarily focused on our crude 
oil properties with $77.9&nbsp;million directed
towards our Fort Berthold crude oil property and $34.5&nbsp;million spent on our
Canadian oil properties. Spending on our natural gas assets included 
$17.1&nbsp;million in the Marcellus and
$6.0&nbsp;million on our deep basin properties in&nbsp;Canada. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Property
and land acquisitions for the second quarter totaled $51.7&nbsp;million, which 
included the acquisition of an incremental 50% working interest in our Pouce 
Coupe light oil
waterflood property for $34.0&nbsp;million after adjustments. Land acquisitions 
totaled $16.7&nbsp;million and were primarily focused on additional acreage 
positions around our existing North
Dakota and Marcellus interests. During the second quarter of 2012 we spent 
$23.6&nbsp;million, which included $8.2&nbsp;million on undeveloped land and 
$15.4&nbsp;million on our Marcellus carry
obligation. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Dispositions  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>During the second 
quarter we recognized aggregate proceeds of $71.3&nbsp;million through our 
disposition activity. The largest transactions were the sale of our Canadian
non-core oil assets in Taylorton and Turner Valley that had production of 
approximately 600&nbsp;BOE/day for proceeds of $57.2&nbsp;million. We also 
disposed of non-core oil assets at Willesden
Green for $6.7&nbsp;million, along with U.S.&nbsp;undeveloped land for 
$7.4&nbsp;million. In aggregate, we recognized losses of $4.5&nbsp;million 
during the quarter on these transactions. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
total capital investment activity for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 are outlined&nbsp;below: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;15</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=15,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=388730,FOLIO='15',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DI76901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:14' -->
<A NAME="page_di76901_1_16"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Subsequent to the 
second quarter, we entered into agreements to divest of non-core Canadian 
properties with production of approximately 1,000&nbsp;BOE/day for
proceeds of approximately $85.4&nbsp;million, before closing adjustments. We 
also closed the sale of certain facilities in our Western U.S.&nbsp;operations 
for proceeds of $34.3&nbsp;million and
entered into a new fee based arrangement with respect to these assets. These 
assets have been classified as assets held for sale on our balance sheet at 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013. See Note&nbsp;15
for further information. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Including
the transactions subsequent to the second quarter, we have sold, or have entered
into agreements to sell, non-core assets for aggregate proceeds of 
$192.3&nbsp;million and
related production of approximately 1,700&nbsp;BOE/day. We have also invested 
approximately $55.7&nbsp;million in property and land acquisitions with related 
production of approximately
400&nbsp;BOE/day. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Depletion, 
Depreciation and Amortization ("DD&amp;A")  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>DD&amp;A of property,
plant and equipment ("PP&amp;E") is recognized using the unit-of-production 
method based on proved plus probable reserves. For the three and six months
ended
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 DD&amp;A increased to $132.5&nbsp;million and 
$259.4&nbsp;million respectively, compared to $128.2&nbsp;million and 
$246.7&nbsp;million during the same periods in 2012,
primarily due to higher production. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Other Assets  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Other assets consist 
of our portfolio of equity investments in other oil and gas companies. These 
investments are carried at their estimated fair value with changes in fair
value recorded in other comprehensive income. The change in fair value of these 
investments for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 resulted 
in unrealized gains of
$2.3&nbsp;million and $3.9&nbsp;million respectively, compared to unrealized 
losses of $46.9&nbsp;million and $51.1&nbsp;million for the same periods last 
year. The unrealized losses in 2012
primarily related to our investment in Laricina Energy&nbsp;Ltd. which we 
disposed of in the third quarter of&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Decommissioning 
Liabilities  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>In connection with 
our operations, we incur abandonment and reclamation costs related to assets 
such as surface leases, wells, facilities and pipelines. Total decommissioning
liabilities included on our balance sheet are estimated by management based on 
our net ownership interest, estimated costs to abandon and reclaim and the 
estimated timing of the costs to be incurred
in future periods. We have estimated the net present value of our 
decommissioning liability to be $552.0&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 
compared to $599.7&nbsp;million at
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. For the six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 
there was a $47.7&nbsp;million decrease in decommissioning liability resulting 
primarily from the change in the
risk-free rate used to calculate the present value of the liability, which 
increased to 2.89% from 2.36% at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. See Notes&nbsp;9 
and&nbsp;15 for further information. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Taxes  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Current Income Taxes 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>We recorded a current
tax expense of $1.4&nbsp;million for the three months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 compared to $3.8&nbsp;million for the same period in 
2012. Our
current tax is comprised mainly of Alternative Minimum Tax ("AMT") payable with 
respect to our U.S.&nbsp;subsidiary. We expect to recover AMT in future years as
an offset to regular
U.S.&nbsp;income taxes otherwise payable. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
continue to expect to pay U.S.&nbsp;cash taxes of approximately 3% of 
U.S.&nbsp;cash flow until 2016. We currently do not expect to pay material cash 
taxes in Canada until after
2016. These estimates may vary depending on numerous factors including commodity
prices, capital spending, tax regulations and acquisition and disposition 
activity. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Deferred Income Taxes
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>We recorded a 
deferred tax expense of $25.9&nbsp;million for the three months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 compared to an expense of $43.1&nbsp;million for the 
same
period in 2012. The decrease in deferred income tax expense is due to lower net 
income during the&nbsp;period. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Net Income  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Net income for the 
second quarter of 2013 was $52.6&nbsp;million or $0.26 per share compared to 
$100.3&nbsp;million or $0.51 per share for the second quarter of 2012. Net
income for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 totaled 
$47.4&nbsp;million or $0.24 per share compared to $66.4&nbsp;million or $0.34 
per share for the same period in&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Increased
production and improvements in realized pricing in 2013 generated higher oil and
gas sales however this was offset by lower mark-to-market gains on our commodity
derivative
instruments and a decrease in gains on asset dispositions. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>16&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb
sp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=197931,FOLIO='16',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DI76901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:14' -->
<A NAME="page_di76901_1_17"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>SELECTED CANADIAN 
AND U.S.&nbsp;FINANCIAL RESULTS  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The following tables 
provide a geographical analysis of key operating and financial results for the 
three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 and&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=10 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1><B>Three months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=10 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1><B>Three months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777"></TD>
</TR>

<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Net
of oil and gas transportation costs, but before the effects of commodity 
derivative instruments. </FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1>(2)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1>U.S.&nbsp;royalties
include state production tax. </FONT></DD></DL>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=18,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=255498,FOLIO='18',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DI76901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:14' -->
<A NAME="page_di76901_1_19"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>QUARTERLY 
FINANCIAL INFORMATION  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Higher realized 
commodity prices combined with increased production volumes contributed to 
higher revenues in the second quarter of 2013. During 2012 oil and gas sales 
were
relatively flat as increasing production volumes were offset by lower realized 
commodity prices. During 2011 we saw higher crude oil prices and declining 
natural gas prices combined with lower
production levels, which resulted in fluctuating oil and gas sales throughout 
the&nbsp;year. </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Net
of oil and gas transportation costs, but before the effects of commodity 
derivative instruments. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>LIQUIDITY AND 
CAPITAL RESOURCES  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>We have continued to 
strengthen our balance sheet and liquidity in 2013. We have seen a significant 
increase in our funds flow and our disposition activities have generated
proceeds of $192.3&nbsp;million, including transactions closing subsequent to 
the quarter. As a result, we have eliminated our year-to-date funding shortfall.
At June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 we have
a conservative trailing 12&nbsp;month debt to cash flow ratio of 1.6x and 
approximately $670.0&nbsp;million of undrawn credit capacity. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
adjusted payout ratio has also shown significant improvement in 2013. Our 
adjusted payout ratio, which is calculated as dividends (net&nbsp;of our stock 
dividends and DRIP
proceeds) plus capital spending and office capital divided by funds flow, was 
89% for the second quarter of 2013 and 106% for the first six months of 2013, 
compared to 197% and 227% for the same
periods in 2012. The decrease in our adjusted payout ratio was a result of lower
capital spending, higher funds flow along with the reduction in our monthly 
dividend from $0.18 to $0.09 at the end of
the second quarter of&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total
debt at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, including the current portion, was 
$1,143.8&nbsp;million compared to $1,069.6&nbsp;million at 
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. Total debt
at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 was comprised of $330.2&nbsp;million of bank 
indebtedness and $813.6&nbsp;million of senior&nbsp;notes. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
working capital deficiency at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, excluding current 
deferred financial assets and credits and held for sale assets and liabilities, 
was $168.6&nbsp;million
compared to $167.2&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. We expect to 
finance our working capital deficit through funds flow and our bank credit 
facility. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
key leverage ratios are detailed below: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Long-term
debt is measured net of cash and includes the current portion of the 
senior&nbsp;notes. </FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-
11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1>(2)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-
family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1>Interest
expense is finance expense excluding non-cash items. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;19</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=19,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=901581,FOLIO='19',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DI76901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:14' -->
<A NAME="page_di76901_1_20"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>At 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 we were in compliance with all covenants under our bank 
credit facility and senior notes. Our bank credit facility and senior
note purchase agreements have been filed as material documents on our SEDAR 
profile at <U>www.sedar.com</U>. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Dividends  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>During the three and
six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 we reported dividends of 
$54.0&nbsp;million ($0.27/share) and $107.8&nbsp;million ($0.54/share)
respectively, of which $11.4&nbsp;million and $21.5&nbsp;million respectively, 
was non-cash and related to our Stock Dividend Program ("SDP"). We continue to 
assess our dividend levels with
respect to anticipated funds flow, debt levels, capital spending plans and 
capital market conditions and do not anticipate any changes at this&nbsp;time. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
SDP allows shareholders to elect to receive their dividends in the form of 
shares instead of cash. Currently approximately 21% of our shareholders 
participate in the SDP,
representing $3.8&nbsp;million of dividends per month. As with our previous 
DRIP, the SDP will serve as a source of capital by allowing us to retain cash 
that would otherwise be paid out
as&nbsp;dividends. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Shareholders' 
Capital  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>During the second 
quarter of 2013, a total of 805,000&nbsp;shares were issued for 
$11.4&nbsp;million pursuant to the SDP and stock option plan. A total of
869,000&nbsp;shares were issued for $12.5&nbsp;million under our former DRIP and
the stock option plan for the same period in 2012. For the six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, a total of
1,584,000&nbsp;shares were issued for $21.5&nbsp;million pursuant to the SDP and
stock option plan, compared to 1,464,000&nbsp;shares issued for 
$25.8&nbsp;million during the same period in
2012 under the SDP, former DRIP and the stock option plan. See Note&nbsp;13 for 
further information. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
had 200,268,000&nbsp;shares outstanding at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 compared to 
197,332,000&nbsp;shares outstanding at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012 and 
198,684,000&nbsp;shares
outstanding at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. The weighted average basic number of
shares outstanding for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 was 
199,430,000
(2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;193,306,000). At August&nbsp;8,&nbsp;2013 we had 
201,109,000&nbsp;shares outstanding. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Change in 
U.S.&nbsp;Filing Status  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Pursuant to 
U.S.&nbsp;securities regulations we expect that we will no longer qualify as a 
"foreign private issuer" as of January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2014 as over 50% of our
common shares are held by U.S.&nbsp;residents and over 50% of our assets are 
located in the U.S.&nbsp;As a result, we believe that we will be considered a 
U.S.&nbsp;domestic issuer and will
become subject to U.S.&nbsp;domestic reporting requirements for all 
U.S.&nbsp;filings completed on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2014, which will 
include our annual 2013&nbsp;filings. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
change in filing status is not expected to impact our operations, but rather it 
will change the way in which we report and file our&nbsp;results. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Some
of the consequences of no longer qualifying as a "foreign private issuer" are 
summarized below. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Financial Statements 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Our financial 
statements will be presented in accordance with United&nbsp;States Generally 
Accepted Accounting Principles ("US&nbsp;GAAP") instead of IFRS beginning with
our year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2013, including the comparative periods 
for 2012 and 2011. The US GAAP financial statements will satisfy our Canadian 
filing obligations and IFRS statements
will no longer be&nbsp;prepared. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
most significant differences between US GAAP and IFRS that are expected to 
impact us relate to the accounting for our oil and gas assets and particularly 
impairment calculations and
the accounting treatment for dispositions. As we are recasting our comparative 
periods in accordance with US GAAP, any previously recorded IFRS asset 
impairments/reversals or gains/losses on asset
dispositions will be reversed and recast in accordance with US GAAP. Other 
differences include different discount rates used for decommissioning 
liabilities associated with our assets along with
differences in balance sheet presentation for our assets. We expect these 
changes will impact our earnings however we do not expect a material change in 
our key performance indicators such as funds
flow, debt levels, capital spending, operating costs, G&amp;A expenses, netbacks
or adjusted payout&nbsp;ratios. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Equity Offerings 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Historically as a 
foreign private issuer we completed Canadian "bought deal" style public 
offerings and separate U.S.&nbsp;prospectuses were not required. As a
U.S.&nbsp;domestic issuer we will generally need to 
file&nbsp;U.S.&nbsp;prospectuses for any private or public equity offerings 
completed after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2014. In addition, we
would continue to be subject to the applicable Canadian prospectus requirements.
These additional filing obligations could impact the cost and execution of our 
equity offerings. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>20&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb
sp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=20,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=689866,FOLIO='20',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]DI76901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD=';8-AUG-2013;16:14' -->
<A NAME="page_di76901_1_21"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Production and 
Reserves Information </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>In accordance with 
U.S.&nbsp;protocol our sales revenue and volumes would be presented on a net
(after royalty) basis. We would also provide supplementary disclosures for
gross sales revenue and volumes to facilitate comparisons with 
Canadian&nbsp;peers. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
reserves information would be prepared and filed under both U.S. and Canadian 
standards. Under U.S.&nbsp;reserve standards proved reserves are generally 
presented, historic
12&nbsp;month average price is held constant and reserves are reported on a net 
(after royalty)&nbsp;basis. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>2013 GUIDANCE  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>A summary of our 2013
guidance is below. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>INTERNAL CONTROLS 
AND PROCEDURES  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Our Chief Executive 
Officer and Chief Financial Officer have evaluated the effectiveness of our 
disclosure controls and procedures and internal control over financial reporting
as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;15 under the U.S.&nbsp;Securities 
Exchange Act of 1934 and as defined in Canada under National Instrument&nbsp;52-
109,
Certification of Disclosure in Issuers' Annual and Interim Filings. Based on 
that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer of 
Enerplus Corporation have concluded that, as at
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, our disclosure controls and procedures and internal 
control over financial reporting were effective. There were no changes in our 
internal control over financial reporting
during the period beginning on April&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2013 and ending 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely 
to materially affect, our internal control
over financial reporting. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>ADDITIONAL 
INFORMATION  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Additional 
information relating to Enerplus, including our current Annual Information Form,
is available under our profile&nbsp;on the SEDAR website at
<U>www.sedar.com</U>, on the EDGAR website at <U>www.sec.gov</U> and at 
<U>www.enerplus.com</U>. </FONT></P>
