</FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION AND 
STATEMENTS  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><I>This MD&amp;A 
contains certain forward-looking information and forward-looking statements 
within the meaning of applicable securities laws
("</I></FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B><I>forward-looking 
information</I></B></FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><I>"). The use of any of 
the words "expect", "anticipate", "continue", "estimate", "guidance", 
"objective", "ongoing", "may",
"will", "project", "should", "believe", "plans", "intends", "budget", "strategy"
and similar expressions are intended to identify forward-looking information. In
particular, but without limiting the
foregoing, this MD&amp;A contains forward-looking information pertaining to the 
following: expected 2013 average production volumes and the anticipated 
production mix; the proportion of our anticipated
oil and gas production that is hedged; the results from our drilling program and
the timing of related production; future oil and natural gas prices and our 
commodity risk management programs; future
royalty rates on our production; anticipated cash and non-cash G&amp;A, equity 
based compensation and financing expenses; operating costs; capital spending 
levels in 2013 and its impact on our production
level and land holdings; our ability to reallocate funds within our 2013 capital
program; potential future asset impairments and reversals; the amount of our 
future abandonment and reclamation costs
and decommissioning liabilities; future environmental expenses; our future 
U.S.&nbsp;cash taxes; deferred income taxes, our tax pools and the time at which
we may pay Canadian cash taxes; future
debt and working capital levels and debt-to-funds-flow ratio and adjusted payout
ratio, financial capacity, liquidity and capital resources to fund capital 
spending and working capital requirements;
the amount and timing of future cash dividends that we may pay to our 
shareholders; the amount and timing of future debt and equity issuances and 
expected use of proceeds therefrom; and the amount and
timing, and use of proceeds from, future asset dispositions; the expected change
of our status from "foreign private issuer" to U.S.&nbsp;domestic issuer as of 
January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2014 and
expected changes in our reporting related thereto; and our ability to improve 
our trading multiple and create significant value for our 
shareholders.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><I>The forward-looking information contained in this 
MD&amp;A reflects several material factors, expectations and assumptions 
including, without limitation: that we will
conduct our operations and achieve results of operations as anticipated; that 
our development plans will achieve the expected results; the general continuance
of current or, where applicable, assumed
industry conditions; the continuation of assumed tax, royalty and regulatory 
regimes; the accuracy of the estimates of our reserve and resource volumes; 
commodity price and cost assumptions; the
continued availability of adequate debt and/or equity financing and funds flow 
to fund our capital, operating and working capital requirements, and dividend 
payments as needed; the continued
availability and sufficiency of our funds flow and availability under our bank 
credit facility to fund our working capital deficiency; the availability of 
third party services; and the extent of our
liabilities. We believe the material factors, expectations and assumptions 
reflected in the forward-looking information are reasonable but no assurance can
be given that these factors, expectations
and assumptions will prove to be&nbsp;correct.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><I>The forward-looking information included in this 
MD&amp;A is not a guarantee of future performance and should not be unduly 
relied upon. Such information involves
known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that may cause actual 
results or events to differ materially from those anticipated in such forward-
looking information including, without
limitation: changes in commodity prices; changes in the demand for or supply of 
our products; unanticipated operating results, results from our capital spending
activities or production declines;
changes in tax or environmental laws, royalty rates or other regulatory matters;
changes in our capital plans or by third party operators of our properties, 
increased debt levels or debt service
requirements; inaccurate estimation of our oil and gas reserve and resource 
volumes; limited, unfavourable or a lack of access to capital markets; increased
costs; a lack of adequate insurance
coverage; the impact of competitors; reliance on industry partners and third 
party service providers; a failure to complete planned asset dispositions on the
terms anticipated or at all; and certain
other risks detailed
from time to time in our public disclosure documents (including, without 
limitation, those risks and contingencies described under "Risk Factors and Risk
Management" in the Annual MD&amp;A and in our
other public&nbsp;filings).</I></FONT></P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=6><B>Notes  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=4>Notes to Condensed 
Consolidated Financial Statements<BR></FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>(unaudited) </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>1. REPORTING 
ENTITY  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>These interim 
condensed consolidated financial statements ("interim Consolidated Financial 
Statements") and notes present the results of Enerplus Corporation including its
Canadian and U.S.&nbsp;subsidiaries. Enerplus is a North American crude oil and 
natural gas exploration and development company. Enerplus is publicly traded on 
the Toronto and New&nbsp;York stock
exchanges under the ticker symbol ERF. Enerplus' head office is located in 
Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The interim Consolidated Financial Statements were 
authorized for issue by the Board of Directors
on August&nbsp;8,&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>2. BASIS OF 
PREPARATION  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Enerplus' interim 
Consolidated Financial Statements present its results of operations and 
financial position under International Financial Reporting Standards ("IFRS") as
issued by the International Accounting Standards Board ("IASB") for the three 
and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 and the 2012 comparative periods. 
They have been prepared in accordance
with IAS&nbsp;34, "Interim
Financial Reporting". These interim Consolidated Financial Statements do not 
include all the necessary annual disclosures as prescribed by IFRS and should be
read in conjunction with Enerplus' audited
Consolidated Financial Statements as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. There have 
been no changes to the use of estimates or judgments since 
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>3. SIGNIFICANT 
ACCOUNTING POLICIES  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>On 
January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2013, Enerplus adopted the following new accounting 
standards that were issued by the IASB. The adoption of these standards did not 
have a material
impact on Enerplus' interim Consolidated Financial Statements. </FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>IFRS&nbsp;7 </FONT> <FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><I>Financial Instruments
Disclosures</I></FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>

COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>IFRS&nbsp;10

Statements</I></FONT><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>As at 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 the E&amp;E asset balance of $797,826,000 
(December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$773,820,000)
consists of undeveloped lands and assets that management has not fully evaluated
for technical feasibility and commercial viability. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;27</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>At 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 $92,677,000 of the net carrying value above has been 
classified as assets held for sale on the Consolidated Balance Sheet. Refer
to Note&nbsp;15 for further information. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>6. IMPAIRMENT  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>During the three and 
six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 Enerplus did not record any 
impairments. For the same periods in 2012, impairment losses were $nil and
$86,906,000 respectively. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>7. OTHER ASSETS  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Other assets of 
$14,260,000 (December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$11,687,000) represent
Enerplus' marketable securities portfolio. For the
three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 the change in fair value of 
these investments represented unrealized gains of $2,345,000 ($2,685,000 before 
tax) and $3,892,000 ($4,456,000
before tax) respectively. For the same periods in 2012, the change in fair value
of these investments represented unrealized losses of $46,901,000 ($53,917,000 
before tax) and $51,077,000 ($58,709,000
before tax) respectively. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>28&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb
sp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>Senior Notes  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The terms and rates 
of the Company's senior notes at June&nbsp;30, 2013 are detailed&nbsp;below: 
</FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777"

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=29,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=418052,FOLIO='29',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]FI76901A.;11',USER='JATHANA',CD=';8-AUG-2013;17:37' -->
<A NAME="page_fi76901_1_30"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>9. DECOMMISSIONING
LIABILITY  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Enerplus has 
estimated the net present value of its decommissioning liability to be 
$551,957,000 at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 compared to $599,652,000 at
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, based on a total undiscounted liability of 
$744,791,000 and $659,714,000 respectively. The decommissioning liability was 
calculated using a risk free rate of 2.89% at
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 (December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;2.36%). 
</FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="66%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777"
SIZE=1>($ thousands)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1><B>Six months<BR>
ended<BR>
June&nbsp;30,<BR>
2013</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1><B>Year ended December&nbsp;31,<BR>
2012</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=6 style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=4 ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE 
COLOR="#0B2777"></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="66%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2> 
Decommissioning liability, beginning of year</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777"
SIZE=2>$</FONT></TD>

June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 $6,562,000 of the total decommissioning liability above

REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;31</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=31,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=291986,FOLIO='31',FILE='DISK108:

<A NAME="page_fi76901_1_32"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>(i) Long-Term 
Incentive Plans </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Enerplus' long-term 
incentive plans include its PSU, RSU and DSU plans. At June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 
the long-term incentive plans had a liability balance of $16,939,000
(December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$13,316,000) which is included in 
accounts payable on the Consolidated Balance&nbsp;Sheet. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following table summarizes the PSU, RSU and DSU activity for the six months 
ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013: </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

SIZE=1>(thousands of units)</FONT></TD>

SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=1><B>PSUs</B></FONT></TD>

SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>Reflects
the expected dividend yield and volatility of Enerplus shares over the life of 
the&nbsp;option. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The weighted average 
grant date fair value of options granted during the six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 was $1.30
(June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$2.52). At June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, 
5,632,000&nbsp;options were exercisable at a weighted average exercise price of 
$24.30
with a weighted average remaining contractual term of 4.4&nbsp;years, giving an 
aggregate intrinsic value of $1,429,000 
(June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$nil).
The weighted average share price during the period was&nbsp;$14.34. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
the six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013, Enerplus expensed a total of 
$5,478,000 related to its stock option plan. The total unamortized fair value of
outstanding options of
$8,198,000 will be recognized in net income over the remaining vesting period. 
Activity for the periods is as&nbsp;follows: </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>(d) Basic and 
Diluted Earnings Per Share  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Net income per share 
has been determined based on the following: </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>14. FINANCIAL 
INSTRUMENTS AND RISK MANAGEMENT  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>(a) Carrying Value
and Fair Value of Non-Derivative Financial Instruments  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>The carrying value of
cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable, dividends payable and bank credit 
facilities approximated their fair value at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 and
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012 due to their short term nature. At 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 the combined fair values of Enerplus' senior notes was 
$865,484,000 and the carrying value was
$813,619,000 (December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;fair value of 
$896,871,000 and carrying value of $808,615,000). The fair value of the senior 
notes was estimated
by discounting future interest and principal payments using available market 
information at the balance sheet&nbsp;date. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=1>ENERPLUS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2013 Q2 
REPORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;33</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0B2777">
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=33,EFW="2216297",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=402625,FOLIO='33',FILE='DISK108:
[13ZCD1.13ZCD76901]FI76901A.;11',USER='JATHANA',CD=';8-AUG-2013;17:37' -->
<A NAME="page_fi76901_1_34"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>(b) Fair Value of 
Derivative Financial Instruments  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Derivative 
instruments are recorded at their estimated fair value using observable market 
inputs, other than quoted prices, at the balance sheet date. The deferred 
financial
assets and credits on the Consolidated Balance Sheets result from recording 
derivative financial instruments at fair&nbsp;value. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following table summarizes the change in fair value for the three months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013: </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>(c) Risk 
Management  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Commodity Price Risk 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>Enerplus manages a 
portion of commodity price risk through a combination of financial derivative 
and physical delivery sales contracts. Enerplus' policy is to enter into
commodity contracts considered appropriate subject to a maximum of 80% of 
forecasted production volumes net of&nbsp;royalties. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following tables summarize Enerplus' price risk management positions at 
July&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2013: </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><I>Crude Oil 
Instruments:  </I></FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2><B>15. ASSETS HELD 
FOR SALE  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" SIZE=2>At 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2013 certain non-core oil and gas properties were classified
as assets held for sale. Enerplus expects these sales to close during the third 
quarter
of&nbsp;2013. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT COLOR="#0B2777" 
SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
carrying amounts reclassified on the Consolidated Balance Sheet are 
as&nbsp;follows: </FONT></P>

on the TransCanada Alberta Transmission System<BR>

benchmark Alberta Index prices</FONT></TD>
